subHeader: Dissertation: 'Evaluating the Security of AI-Generated Code: A Quantitative Study Using a Custom Scoring Framework'
highlights: Pursuing a Ph.D. focused on AI Safety, Alignment, and Model Reliability.
Developing a hybrid vulnerability scoring framework combining OWASP, CVSS, and model-specific behavioral metrics.
Researching how prompt design influences downstream system behavior, risk exposure, and model consistency.
Conducting empirical evaluations of AI-generated code to identify failure modes, drift patterns, and exploit pathways.
Building behavioral test harnesses to measure hallucination rates, determinism, and reliability under adversarial inputs.
Translating ethical principles—transparency, fairness, non-manipulative UX—into actionable prompt-layer constraints.

degree: Master of Science in Information Technology Management
subHeader: 4.0 GPA with coursework emphasizing Cybersecurity and Infrastructure
highlights: Specialized coursework in Cybersecurity, Risk Management, and IT Infrastructure
Capstone focused on IT Policy and Strategic Technology Management

degree: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
